pum pum-overlay pum-theme-6083 pum-theme-default-theme popmake-overlay click_open
pum-container popmake theme-6083 pum-responsive pum-responsive-normal responsive size-normal
pum-content popmake-content
div.p: Awardee, Human Resources Director Sue Johnson with District Superintendent Dr. Kristi Sandvik.

div.class: pum pum-overlay pum-theme-6083 pum-theme-default-theme popmake-overlay click_open
pum-container popmake theme-6083 pum-responsive pum-responsive-medium responsive size-medium
pum-content popmake-content
div.center: Awardee, Human Resources Director Sue Johnson with District Superintendent Dr. Kristi Sandvik.

div.class: pum pum-overlay pum-theme-6083 pum-theme-default-theme popmake-overlay click_open
pum-container popmake theme-6083 pum-responsive pum-responsive-medium responsive size-medium
pum-content popmake-content
div.center: Sue Helm is a volunteer at Jasinski Elementary School. She is a retired employee of the Buckeye Elementary School District. She was nominated for her outstanding support and coordination of the Read on Buckeye Program at Jasinski Elementary School.

div.class: pum pum-overlay pum-theme-6083 pum-theme-default-theme popmake-overlay click_open
pum-container popmake theme-6083 pum-responsive pum-responsive-medium responsive size-medium
pum-content popmake-content
div.center: Nijya is true example of a student passionate about success. Her work ethic is exceptional; Nijya strives for success. She goes above and beyond in all areas of school. Currently, she serves as president for the National Junior Honor Society, plays sports and maintains a high GPA. Nijya is the first to volunteer assistance, and her attitude of cheerfulness certainly adds a bright spot to Buckeye Elementary School.

div.class: pum pum-overlay pum-theme-6083 pum-theme-default-theme popmake-overlay click_open
pum-container popmake theme-6083 pum-responsive pum-responsive-medium responsive size-medium
pum-content popmake-content
div.center: Meghan Pablo, an 8th grader at WestPark Elementary is considered a natural leader. She takes on any responsibility and is always the first person to volunteer with her peers are hesitant. Meghan has taken the Equity Student Leadership Club to new levels with her involvement. Meghan exemplifies the type of student that all students aspire to be.

div.class: pum pum-overlay pum-theme-6083 pum-theme-default-theme popmake-overlay click_open
pum-container popmake theme-6083 pum-responsive pum-responsive-medium responsive size-medium
pum-content popmake-content
div.center: Marianna, an 8th grader at Sundance Elementary School, is described as “a hard-working student who exemplifies the qualities of great character at Sundance.” She is pictured with her family and Dr. Sandvik.

div.class: pum pum-overlay pum-theme-6083 pum-theme-default-theme popmake-overlay click_open
pum-container popmake theme-6083 pum-responsive pum-responsive-medium responsive size-medium
pum-content popmake-content
pum pum-overlay pum-theme-6083 pum-theme-default-theme popmake-overlay click_open
pum-container popmake theme-6083 pum-responsive pum-responsive-medium responsive size-medium
pum-content popmake-content
pum pum-overlay pum-theme-6083 pum-theme-default-theme popmake-overlay click_open
pum-container popmake theme-6083 pum-responsive pum-responsive-medium responsive size-medium
pum-content popmake-content
pum pum-overlay pum-theme-6083 pum-theme-default-theme popmake-overlay click_open
pum-container popmake theme-6083 pum-responsive pum-responsive-medium responsive size-medium
pum-content popmake-content
div.center: Heather is in her 10th year as a teacher at Sundance Elementary School. As an Academic Coach, she works tirelessly helping her fellow teachers achieve success in their classrooms.

div.class: pum pum-overlay pum-theme-6083 pum-theme-default-theme popmake-overlay click_open
pum-container popmake theme-6083 pum-responsive pum-responsive-medium responsive size-medium
pum-content popmake-content
pum pum-overlay pum-theme-6083 pum-theme-default-theme popmake-overlay click_open
pum-container popmake theme-6083 pum-responsive pum-responsive-medium responsive size-medium
pum-content popmake-content
div.center: Erica is described as being “truly passionate about student success.”

div.class: pum pum-overlay pum-theme-6083 pum-theme-default-theme popmake-overlay click_open
pum-container popmake theme-6083 pum-responsive pum-responsive-medium responsive size-medium
pum-content popmake-content
div.center: Dylan volunteers countless hours assisting a variety of clubs, PTSA and school related events. He is described by the assistant principal at Inca Elementary School as going “above and beyond trying to help make Inca a great place to learn and grow.”

div.class: pum pum-overlay pum-theme-6083 pum-theme-default-theme popmake-overlay click_open
pum-container popmake theme-6083 pum-responsive pum-responsive-medium responsive size-medium
pum-content popmake-content
div.center: Diamond is recognized with the community member P.A.S.S. Award for Inca Elementary School. She is the secretary for the PTSA and is active with the school carnival, fundraising nights, curriculum nights, book fairs and many other school events.

div.class: pum pum-overlay pum-theme-6083 pum-theme-default-theme popmake-overlay click_open
pum-container popmake theme-6083 pum-responsive pum-responsive-medium responsive size-medium
pum-content popmake-content
div.center: Dan Bunnell, WestPark Elementary School volunteer, joined by his children and Dr. Sandvik.

div.class: pum pum-overlay pum-theme-6083 pum-theme-default-theme popmake-overlay click_open
pum-container popmake theme-6083 pum-responsive pum-responsive-medium responsive size-medium
pum-content popmake-content
div.center: Cristal Weaver, left, is joined by Dr. Sandvik and Bales Elementary School principal Fred Lugo, and her husband Darrin who is on the phone. Darrin is also being recognized with a P.A.S.S Award. He was out of town on business, so he was surprised with a phone call from Dr. Sandvik.

div.class: pum pum-overlay pum-theme-6083 pum-theme-default-theme popmake-overlay click_open
pum-container popmake theme-6083 pum-responsive pum-responsive-medium responsive size-medium
pum-content popmake-content
div.center: Cody, an 8th grade student at Jasinski Elementary School, shares his recognition with his sister.

div.class: pum pum-overlay pum-theme-6083 pum-theme-default-theme popmake-overlay click_open
pum-container popmake theme-6083 pum-responsive pum-responsive-medium responsive size-medium
pum-content popmake-content
div.center: Byron Clark, volunteer at Buckeye Preschool, is described as “always so kind and willing to help with anything we ask him to do.”

div.class: pum pum-overlay pum-theme-6083 pum-theme-default-theme popmake-overlay click_open
pum-container popmake theme-6083 pum-responsive pum-responsive-medium responsive size-medium
pum-content popmake-content
div.center: Buckeye Elementary School District Purchasing Manger, Bobby Williams is a 2017 P.A.S.S. award recipient

div.class: pum pum-overlay pum-theme-6083 pum-theme-default-theme popmake-overlay click_open
pum-container popmake theme-6083 pum-responsive pum-responsive-medium responsive size-medium
pum-content popmake-content
div.center: Aimee Singleterry, Kindergarten teacher at Jasinski Elementary School with principal Dr. Donna Fitzgerald, right, and Dr. Kristi Sandvik, left.

div.class: pum pum-overlay pum-theme-6083 pum-theme-default-theme popmake-overlay click_open
pum-container popmake theme-6083 pum-responsive pum-responsive-medium responsive size-medium
pum-content popmake-content
div.p: Aimee Singleterry, Kindergarten teacher at Jasinski Elementary School with principal Dr. Donna Fitzgerald, right, and Dr. Kristi Sandvik, left.
